text: Not a bad gose, moderately tart and wheaty with a grapefruit-peel bitterness on top of a mild straw-like sweet base. Remains sour on the finish, with bread and salt on the fade. Nose is kinda meh, pilsner-ish with a little bit of sulfur, but the pours pretty, bright gold with a frothy white top and substantial lacing. Good feel as well. Solid summer beer.
Can. Pours a cloudy orange gold with medium white head that lasts. The aroma is sea salt, wheat, citrus, earth. Medium body, similar flavors to nose, nice tartness, light finish, very good.
Can at Muckfest 2017. Nose is moderately hoppy. Light earthy funkiness. Hazy gold. Tart flavor with grassy hops. Thin. Not much salt character. Nice.

Can. Honey yellow colour. Lush airy well-lacing head. Fruity nose. Peach, passion fruit, orange, grapes. Light salt. Wheat malts. Light body. Lively carbonated. The flavour is fruity and dry. Hugely refreshing and delicious gose.

Can from Beergium. Hazy yellow color, white head. Sour taste with citrus, ripe fruits, salt, tart, grass and earthy notes. Sour finish with citrus, sea salt, ripe fruits, tart and grass. Very nice gose.
Bottle at Habel's. Pours hazy golden with white head. Aroma of citrus, lemon, mango, rubber, cat piss, flowers. Taste sour and fruity with very little salt. Thin bodied.

Umiarkowany kwasek, delikatne muśnięcie soli i pełno cudownego naturalnego smaku i aromatu przywodzącego na myśl czerwoną odmianę pomarańczy. Wysoce nasycone, bardzo orzeźwiające, świetnie zbalansowane. Wygląd tylko nieco kulał.
Piwo skonsumowane. Ocena na podstawie retrospekcji w celu uzupełnienia profilu.
16 oz can. Wheat and citrus aroma. Medium body, fruity taste. Juicy oranges, just the right amount of sour. Mild bitterness on the end. Great stuff.

Salt and a little raspberry. Pours orange with good head and lacing. Good finish, with tang. Good balance like Iceland on the continental divide between Europe and North America. Tap at Mikkeller in Reykjavik.
Orange aroma and flavor is muted. Medium sour. Cloudy golden color. 3.8% ABV is definitely "sessionable".

Bottle. Hazy golden with a nice white head. Amazing fresh aroma of of red and black currant, tropical fruit, citrus, lactic bacteria. Medium sour taste, light to medium body, medium carbonation, milky texture. Fresh and aromatic, beautiful!
On tap 50cl. Small white layer, hazy fruit color. Aroma is gooseberries, rhubarb, nettles. Taste is sour mix.

Tap 0,33l. Pours an orange colour. Aroma of tart vinegar and sweet tart orange juice. Taste of salty savoury bread , oranges, tart, fruity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Beer52. Pale hazy orange with a thin white head and a moderate fizz. Nice sharp lemon aroma. Taste is pineapple, lemon and a light but growing saltiness?. Pleasantly but not overly tart. Some wheat and lime too and just a very light bitterness in the finish. Maybe a little watery but grew on me. Refreshing and enjoyable.

Keg at Wild Beer at Wapping Wharf, Bristol, Gloucs. Clouded gold with white head. Sharp, fresh, acidic fruits lead the way here. Tart citrus with a cooking apple side plate. The saltiness must be really restrained as I didnt really get it. Sour acidity in the close. Good stuff.

Can 500 ml / Bier-Bienne (CH). Veiled golden beer with a nice white head low during but with laces on the glass. Fruity and sourish aromas, orange, lemon and pineapple. The taste is acid and sour, with lemon, salt, vivacity of wheat, Vichy Célestins. With citrus, we find fruity of orange and gooseberry. Very fresh.

11.2oz bottle from Prairie Trail Hy-Vee, in a Sam Smith pint glass. Scent of ripe oranges and maybe... peaches? With soft undertones of light beer and seawater. Not a strong smell, but perhaps reminiscent of a walk through an orchard in season. Pours hazy golden yellow with a finger of big bubbly head that dissipates after a few minutes and then reasserts itself as a thin foamy cover. Gentle but steady effervescence rising up from the bottom. Nice lacing as you work your way down the glass. A very pretty gose beer. Creamy malt with some real body to it and seawater up front, followed by a nice mouth-watering tang and orange flavor mid-palate, with a moderate refreshing finish where the peachy qualities assert themselves. Light- to medium-bodied, definitely among the heavier gose beers Ive had in recent years, with excellent carbonation. Mild saltwater astringency, as expected, and still totally refreshing and easy to drink. A magnificent brew! The more I taste it, the more I like it! With all the flavor and character packed into these humble 11 ounces, this gives some of the best goses Ive ever had a real run for their money! Good health To Øl!

UPDATED: MAR 14, 2017 Can. Light bread and grain for the malt light to moderate orange peel and herbs for the hops, dried leaves and meadow for the yeast, with a note of paper in the background. Head is large, frothy, white with good lacing and is mostly lasting. Color is hazy light amber. Flavor starts moderately acidic and sour, then finishes lightly acidic, faintly bitter and salty. Palate is light to medium, watery with a lively to fizzy carbonation and finishes lightly dry. An excellent Gose with an IPAish hop aroma.

Aroma - predominantly sourish, a lot of soured malt, yeasts, some fermented fruits, green apricots, lemon juice. Taste - strong sourness, a lot of malt and yeasts, very soured lemon juice, green apricots, a bit of pickled cabbage. Very good!

Mir zu seicht. Klar, leicht stinkiger Schwefelduft auf einem Bett of green Roses, wecken auf jeden Fall das Interesse. Der Trunk ist allerdings deutlich zuuu blumig weich. Spülifavours und mineralisch zitronig zum Schluss.

33cl bottle @Cimmeria, Oviedo. 15-02-2017.
BBD: 16-11-2017.
In short: fruity tart salty ale.
Pours some hazy dark gold with frothy white head. Moderate head retention, some good lacing. Fruity, tart, citrusy nose. Light body, high carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is citrusy, some salty, little tart, dry finish. Refreshing and enjoyable.

330ml bottle. Pours orange. All salty savoury bread up front, a little tart vinegar and then a wash of glorious sweet tart orange juice to finish. Obviously used lovely oranges. This is exactly what a fruit gose should be. Clean, tart, fruity. Delicious.

Tap at Mellow. Pours a hazy neon straw color with a finger of foam. Lovely citrus nose with good wheat character. Light and crushable. Tart wheat, lemon and a touch of salt on the finish with some gooseberry. This is really good.
Fresh oranges and sweet lychee, super fruity, zesty, light salt compliments, smooth light-med lactic sour, bit of a tart finish, light sweet

330ml bottle
Hazy straw with great 1 finger head.
Aroma is pineapple, grapefruit, pine resin.
Tart initial sourness with fruity lemon body and a slight salty tang.
Pretty decent.

Pours hazy golden with a large, staying creamy white head. Aroma has lovely fresh hops, oranges, grapefruit, citrus, bergamot, soft tartness. Medium to high carbonation, fine dry light creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has fresh tart citrus zest, light wheat, soft salt. Fine and elegant.

Can pours hazy golden with a large and lacy white head. Aroma is loads of citrus, orange zest, lemony cleansing agent, herbal notes, salt. Flavor is quite tart, a bit of cleanser in there but good, citrusy, herbal, hint of salt. Feel is crisp, a bit astringent, well carbed. Good, but arent they missing a "Frankie" in the name of this one?
Tap at pub. Pours hazy yellow with medium sized white head. Aroma is sour citrus, mandarin and lemon. Taste is sour lemon. Pretty nice!
Enticing citrus aroma in a hazy gold pour. Refreshingly tart citrus taste with a restrained sour body and finish. A brilliant breakfast (OJ) beer.
Tåkete gulbrun med fingerhøyt hvitt skum. Lukter gummi, syregress, rognebær, kulturmelk og gjær. Sursyrlg smak. Sydhavsfrukt, sitrusskall, hvete og syrefress. Middels lang
On tap at Beer Station, Xiamen. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Aroma of orange. Sour orange taste and finish.

Pours completely hazy straw yellow, topped with a medium small frothy white head. Very lovely citrusy note, tangerine and orange notes with soury feel to it. Puckery start with decent sourness, very notable saltiness in the end. Some herbs felt in the aftertaste. What Id expect from a gose. Superbly fresh and refreshing.
Hazy light golden colour with a big, creamy head. Aroma is sea salt. Taste is tart with some orange and salt notes.

To Öl still kept this traditional at heart,while adding orange juice.

Bottle. It pours hazy golden with a creamy white head. The aroma is citrusy hoppy with gooseberry and grapefruit notes. Salty and citrusy flavor with orange and gooseberry notes. Salty and bitter finish.
1st Gose made me love this sort of beer, this one so tasty & unique i have no words )
Hazy gold with a thin white head. Lemony, a bit of tropical fruit, slightly funky aroma. Taste is tart, slight salt, citrus and peach, finishes a little bitter and sour. Great hot weather beer.

Draft to taster at Ei8ht Ball from notes. Pours a hazy yellow golden color with a small white head. The aroma and flavor have tart lemony citrus, pale wheat malts, salt, some funk, some acidity, pretty much a basic Gose.

Backlog. Old review 
Fruity (citrus and tropical fruit) aromas, a light sea breeze scentVery nicely fruity with a salty finish
On tap. Hazy yellow, fluffy head. Peach, passion fruit and oranges aroma, salty flavour, light citric, fruity
Hazy golden yellow color, big fluffy white head, solid lacing. Aroma of floral perfume and fresh fruit. Taste is salty fruit.
Leuke Gose. Mooi uitgebalanceerd. Zuur, zout en citrus (pompelmoes) in balans met de hop.
At the compound, Pours a hazy golden from a can. Smell and flavor of dirty butt, celery, salt water, and tangy stuff. Light bodied.

Draft sample at Cafe Gollem Amstelstraat Amsterdam Pubcrawl. 15.10.2016. Thanks guys for sharing. Pour it hazy orange color with medium white head. Aroma of orange zest and floral. Taste sweet fruity, flowers fresh crazy, little bit sourish feel, nice citrus finish, grains in the middle, perfectly balanced, really nice smooth feel all the time, medium body, creamy, lively, long finish.
Best beer of my lunchtime flight (dont judge me!), this yellow brew is heavy on the citrus without being very bitter, lightly salty and refreshing, with a light crisp body. Good stuff.
This rather adventurous brew reminds me of saying: "One person with passion is better than forty people merely interested." -E. M. Forster

Can. Stein. Golden, medium hazy with medium to big, semi-densed head. Average head retention and lacing. Nice spicy aroma, light topical fruits aroma with some citrus notes. Very nicely balanced (sweet, salty and sour, but first of all sour), whats more these nice complimentary hoppy character makes it really good. The oranges are noticeable somewhere in the end, Id say very ripe oranges, but still oranges. Taste.... is very complex - the sourness is present from the beginning, at first lightly, ended up with medium sourness, it disappears quite quickly, broken by mild sweetness. In overall very drinkable and balanced gose with nice fruity aroma. One of the best Ive very dunken. Definitely go for it.
Intense smell of orange, slightly sour, nice bitterness, no salt, no spicy aromatics. Great start, good finish but the finish is no Gose.
Super intense aroma of oranges, instable head though. Pleasant sourness, light, crisp refreshing with bitterness of oranges in the end.
Tap. Orange golden color. Gooseberries and gummi bears in the aroma. Moderately sour flavor with gummi bears. Apple, gooseberries. Very nice.

Bottle at home. Aroma is tart fruits, zesty citrus, lemon, salty notes, orange, touch of tropical fruits. Flavour is mildly salty and sour with a little bitterness in the finish. Body is light. Nicely crisp and citrussy with a tasty sourness and some salty notes, deal me in for another pour of this lovely Gose.
On tap at Gollem Amstelstraat. Hazy golden colour, white head. Aroma of sour peach candy. Flavour is likewise, quite tart but really refreshing. Nice.
Draught @ Gollem Amstelstraat, Amsterdam. Slightly unclear orange color, medium sized white head. Aroma is orangepeel. Taste orangepeel, a bit salty and citrus fruity. Quite decent.

Aroma - tart and tangy wheat, 
Appearance - the body is a slightly clouded gold. There is decent nucleation. The head is white and 2". Head settles slowly and into a big foam deposit, with lace deposits throughout.
Taste - there is a tangy wheat, slight white grape, slight salty quality. Some faint orange.
Palate - medium body, average carbonation, and a dry and tart finish.

very hazy pale yellow colour, moderate sized white head; aroma of grapefruit, lemon, some oraange zest, red berries, pine notes, hints of tangerine and maybe some juniper; taste is very lemony with some bitterish grapefruit, wheat, sour milk, and hints of salt; perfect gose

Piana wysoka, drobna, leciutko zdobi szkło. Aromat w sumie bardziej wpada grejpfrut niż w pomarańczę. Trochę chmielowego cytrusa, trochę takiego zielonego chmielu. Nie wydaje się jakoś super intensywny, mimo wszystko. W smaku dość mocno nasycone, w stronę wytrawnego, kwas średni w stronę wysokiego. Mocno owocowe, cierpki finisz. Mocno owocowe, cierpki finisz. Soli jako takiej tu nie odczuwam, raczej po prostu podbija owocowość na finiszu. Jest spoko, odczuwalna jest zarówno kwaśność jak i sznyty chmielowe. Chyba po prostu nie jestem wielkim fanem gose.

Zapach średnio intensywny, pomarańcze, cytrusy, owoce tropikalne, zboże. Kolor żółty, mętne. Piana obfita, drobna, średnio trwała, zdobi szkło. W smaku lekka słodycz, średnia kwaśność, lekka słoność, niska pełnia, pomarańcze, owoce tropikalne, zboże. Goryczka niska, wysycenie niskie.

Color dorado anaranjado claro, translúcido, con capa de espuma blanca de más de dos dedos de grosor, buena retención. Poca carbonatación, entra como un refresco sin apenas gas. Aroma cítrico y ácido. Sabor ácido, de naranja y limón, con toque salado super interesante. Muy bebible. Una maravilla de To Øl de solo 3,8% perfecta para días calurosos.

Quite brilliant whether it blurs the lines or not in this case I don not care. Very soft mouthfeel, delicate, and great balance of sour, sweet and salty. Clear, gold, some lacing. Fruity nose. Taste is complex. Fruit including mainly peach / mango, with a bit of citrus, super dry finish. The taste and palate are superb along with the overall composition of the beer.

Can. Hazy orange beer with a large white head. Aroma is spicy with notes of citrus, grapefruit, wheat, oranges and sour milk. Flavor is sour with notes of citrus, grapefruit, oranges, wheat and herbs. Well balanced.
Great thirst quencher, could drink it all day! Great balance of orange, salt, sour, savoury malt and citra hops. Spot on.
Bottle. Medium high lasting flufy white head. Clear amber body. Mild slightly acidic to sour but far from as salty as feared aroma and flavor. Hints of lemon and oranges. Short bitter finish.

Pours a hazy orange-copper with a foamy white head. Aroma is orange and citrus hops and salty brine. Flavor is orange, salt, and citrus hops. Tart, but not too tart. Has lots of carbonation and a light, crisp body. Good.

Data ważności:  06.04.2017 
 Kolor:  Jasnopomarańczowy, piwo jest opalizujące. 
 Piana:  Bielusieńka zbudowana z drobnych pęcherzyków powietrza.
Świetnie radzi sobie na powierzchni piwa i ucieka w dół po odpowiednim czasie. Na szczęście pozostawia dla pocieszenia oka liczne kropeczki. 
 Zapach:  Aromat jest głęboko cytrusowy. Skórki pomarańczy, limonki, mandarynki i cytryna.
W oddali lekka zbożowość.
Jest też charakterystyczna kwaśna nuta, która mnie się zawsze kojarzy z ogórkami kiszonymi i kapustą kwaszoną.
W dalekim tle coś na kształt kolendry.
Fajnie, leciutko i rześko. 
 Smak:  Dobitnie kwaśne, ale na tej samej płaszczyźnie owocowe.
Potężnie owocowe. Gorzka pomarańcza, limonka, pomelo, a w drugim rzucie trawa cytrynowa.
Lekkie pszeniczne ciałko, a na końcu języka sugestia kolendry.
Ponownie na języku pojawiają się skojarzenia z ogórkami kiszonymi.
Po kilku łykach pojawia się też minimalna ziołowość.
Fantastyczny balans pomiędzy słodyczą owoców cytrusowych, a kwaśną odsłoną piwa.
Piwo jest umiarkowanie kwaśne, a słony posmak w ustach pojawia się dopiero po chwili.
Te dwie odsłony piwa bardzo dobrze ze sobą współgrają.
Ciało jest lekkie, tekstura średnia.
Goryczka niewielka, krótka.
Piwo cechuje niezwykła sesyjność.
Wspaniałe Gose! 
 Wysycenie:  Średnie. 
 Podsumowanie:  

No cóż nie jest to zbyt popularny styl. W swoim życiu piłem może z 5-6 Gose.
Najlepszymi były jak dla mnie Gose z Westbrook Brewing Company oraz Melon Gose z Anderson Valley Brewing Company.
Myślę że to będzie trzecie w komplecie;)
Jego największą zaletą jest niebotyczna pijalność, rześkość i lekkość.
Uwielbiam takie piwa! Mógłbym wypić takich kilka pod rząd i wcale by mi się to nie znudziło.
Bardzo dobry balans między słoną stroną piwa, kwaśną i owocową. Tak po 33,33% udziału dla każdej z nich.
To Øl jak zawsze na topie!
Tall boy can, pours a cloudy blond colour. Nose of a nice fruity aroma. Flavour of light sourness and even some funk. Dry with hint of salt presence. Tasty

Tasting at Matts, canCloudy blond color. Wonderful fruity aroma, mandarin, and tropical fruits; light lactic and funky touch. Dry but smooth, acidic to the right point, with moderate salt presence, and plenty of fruit: citrus fruits, tropical fruits, mango; juicy, fresh.Wonderful.

500mL can, pours a cloudy golden with a small white head. Nose brings out a shit ton of salt, followed by dank, skunky notes, and herbal notes. Flavour brings out tons of citrus upfront, followed by light herbal grassiness, subdued salt, and coriander. Bright, punchy and skunky on the finish. Solid.
Pours a lightly cloudy orange colour with a lasting white head. Aroma of orange and a touch of coriander. Very citrusy flavour. Great orange beer, but not super salty. Refreshing!
Can - Orange peel and some tartness. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Nice acidity and fresh orange with some light salt. Not enough salt for a gose, but still quite nice.
can. Hazy golden yellow with two finger head. Tart and funky. Salt comes through fairly well. Brett adds a nice complexity. One of the more interesting and tasty gose beers that Ive had.

On tap at Sir Williams, Ljubljana. It was a really hot day so I decided to give this a try. Orange colour, head is kinda yellowish. It smells beautiful. Like an IPA but a bit different. First sip is very strange. Its a totally new still for me so I didnt like it at first but when I made another two sips I found it fantasticaly refreshing. Conclusion: its different than anything else but I liked it very much, its so refreshing! Ill definetely buy a can or two in case of a another hot day before autumn. Nice work To-Ol!
Tall boy. Hazy golden yellow color, big fluffy white head, solid lacing. Aroma of floral perfume and fresh fruit. Taste is salty fruit.

0,5l on tap at Sir Williams pub and 0,5l can a few days later. Pours hazy yellow with a finger of white head that quickly disappears. Strong citrus aroma with hints of pears and some tropical fruit, its also a bit funky. Light body with crisp refreshing sourness and strong taste of grapefruit, hints of biscuit malt, tropical fruits and yeast are present. Carbonation is average. dry, slightly salty finish with lingering sourness. Very refreshing, very good!

Cloudy yellow pour with a single finger head. Peach aroma. Taste is full of peaches and some brine. Light bodied. Peach skin comes to mind with hints of bitterness from that peel flavor. Dry finish. Lace present.

Canned. Pours slightly hazy golden with an average white head. Aroma of lemon and a little tropical fruits. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up being dry and salty with bitter notes. Light bodied, watery texture and lively carbonation. A nice Gose. 🌟🌟🌟

Bottle. LIght yellow color slightly hazy with firm long lasting white head. Aroma of lemon, grapefruit. Light body, lively carbonation. Taste is pleasantly sour. Overal very refreshing beer summer beer.

Piwo metne w kolorze zoltym z obfita biala grubopecherzykowa piana. W aromacie cytrusy, kwaskowosc i troche chmielowe. W smaku jest zarowno kwasnosc jak i sol, wysycenie na srednim poziomie, goryczka na bardzo niskim poziomie. Bardzo pijalne, orzezwiajace i lekkie. Jedno z lepszych gose jakie mialem okazje pic!

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a pale slightly hazy yellow with a big but fading white head and an aroma of vinegar, orange, lemon wheat, grapefruit and sour cherries. The taste is nicely sour/tart with some slight hops. Not bad

oranges wheat lemon salt orange peel citrus grapefruit lime fruit sour white tart hazy golden malts hops dry sweet salty carbonation yellow crisp fruity tartness

500ml can pours a slightly hazy straw color with a finger and a half of white head that settles quickly leaving very little lacing on the glass. Aroma is orange zest with some lemon and malts. Taste is a lemon and orange zest sourness with a light fruity and malty sweetness. Light bodied with good carbonation. Overall, refreshing and easy drinking sour ale.
Can shared. Smells a bit like feet but nice light fruity body gently sour and lemony. Could drink stuff like this all summer.

Aromat - wyraźnie chmielowy, cytrusowy, słonawo kwaśny.
Piana - obfita, biała, drobna, zdobi szkło.

Bardzo kwaśne, orzeźwiające, delikatnie słone, pomarańczowe. Nasycenie niskie do średniego.
@ BRUS, CPH 16-8-11: tydlig syrligt spad med toner av apelsin och lime. Lätt frisk och god.
On tap at Brus. Hazy golden with a white head. Medium sour with citrus, light bread and grass. Kind of easy to drink.

Cloudy yellow, quickly dissaperaring head. Aroma: lime, corrainder, lactic acid, some hoppy style fruits. Medium body, medium to high sourness. Fruits nicely complement sourness, gentle salty, mainly on finish. Nice thing is that oranges are only addition, they doesnt dominate.

Aroma: lemony (coriander) and yougurty-sour, hint of sweet flower scent. In taste medium sourness with lemon/citrusy tartness. Dry, medium carbonation, and medium bodied with slick and smooth texture. Highly drinkable.
Pours amber with light head. Aroma is lemon, flowers, lime, fresh fruits, some sourness. Taste is floral, sourish juice, red currant, berries. Very good and refreshing beer!

Tallboy can from Kenny Road Market: murky gold pour with actively bubbling carbonation and white head. aroma is lightly sour citrus medley. tastes are grapefruit, orange, melon. light even tart and salt levels. little biscuity and dank. faint floral bitter. very nice.

330 ml bottle at the Hoppy Pub, Thessaloniki. Hazy yellow golden color with white head. Aroma is hoppy and yeasty, grass, citrus, grapefruit, tropical fruits, funky, dusty, salty. Sweet light bitter and light salty taste. Medium oily body with soft carbonation.
Cloudy pale orange with a fluffy head. Aroma has citrus, oranges, yogurt. Light mouthfeel, nice salty sourness with a tingling hop note from the Citra. Extremely Quenching

Tap at Mikkeller Bangkok. Poured a hazy light Amber with a thin broken white head and some broken lace. The aroma is orange citrus, yeast, The flavour is moderate sour with a light, crisp, refreshing, citrus, fruit, yeast, sour grapefruit, biscuit malt palate. Light to medium bodied with average carbonation. Good but not great.
Barwa jasno bursztynowa, piana intensywna, biała. Aromat słodkich pomarańczy, białe pieczywo. W smaku kwaśne. Słodkie pomarańcze bardzo wyraźne. Finisz lekko mineralny.

How: Bottle.
Where: Tasting 2016-05-28.
Appearance: Clear golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, sour, grapefruit.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, citrus, acidic.
On tap. Pale white golden color, hazy liquid, white head. Aroma of lemon. Taste is heavy sour, light salty. Not bad, but almost the same as simple lemon juice, which is ten times cheaper.

Plucky fruity sourness, great mouth feel. Bubbly and satisfying. But yogurt like almost, with great mouth filling flavour. Solid ending bitterness actually. Really liked it! (33cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

On tap at The Bottle Shop Bermondsey. Hazy gold orange colour thin white head. Good attractive citrus aroma. Oranges and tangerines. Some lovely orange fruit in the mouth touch of salty sourness on the finish. Good for a gose for my tastebuds. Good.

Aroma: tart, grassy, citrus, lemongrass, wheat, oranges, fresh (salt)
Appearance: blond to orange, white head, ok retention.
Taste: similar to aroma, but with more milky feel from the lactic bacteria work, light bitterness probably from oranges (bit astringent),medium sourness, light sweetness.light body, slick feel, fluffy, lively, astringent, sour, fresh. 
overall: nice and pleasant, quite drinkable, just enough of complexity.

Dobre jest, ale tez nie kleje hajpu Rami Rami is drinking a Gose To Hollywood by To Øl at BrewDog WarszawaLepiej niz wspominalem :)Ocena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
BottleHazy yellow colour with small white head.Aroma is fruity of Oranges and mandarin,slight sourish but still refreshing mouthfeels some flavor of wheat aswell and overall nice beer.
Tap @ Keller, Tartu. Pours amber with light head. Aroma is lemon, flowers, lime, fresh fruits, some sourness. Taste is floral, sourish juice, red currant, berries. Very good and refreshing beer!

July 1, 2016. Can at home. Best before April 6, 2017. 
Hazy golden with a medium sized, slowly dissipating white head. Aroma is fruity and tart with lemon, orange, rhubarb, gooseberries, wheat grain, coriander. Taste is tart, fruity with a very light salty touch. Finish is slightly dry, fruity acidity with a good amount of malic acid giving it rhubarb and green apple notes, some lemon, orange notes as well. A Gose with oranges and hopped with Citra - another one that stretches the traditional features of an old beer style. Curious if this combination works. Thin but stable, off-white, lacing head over a hazy old gold coloured beer with greenish hue. Unusual but, in all, appetizing aroma of yuzu and orange peel rather than sweet orange flesh, though a fruit sweetness is certainly there as well, fitting in perfectly with the fragrant, delicate lime blossom and tangerine bouquet of the Citra; other than that, there is the Sauerkraut accent typifying most Goses and suggestions of raw rhubarb, moldy lemon, white bread, freshly cut sorrel leaves, unripe gooseberry and redcurrant. Lively, estery onset, lots of citrusy fraîcheur but unripe stonefruit as well, vaguely sweetish but more crisply sour, drying and a bit puckering, shortly after which the classic salt accent appears, subtly so and blending in well with the acidity to create a light Sauerkraut-like sensation; lactic tartness prevails and along with the sourish fruit flavors draws a line all the way to the back, bridging a soft, lightly bready malt and wheat background. Carbonation is sharpish but does not numb or distract.  The citrus acidity returns in the finish in a very convincing, utterly refreshing way, as in fresh-squeezed orange and lemon juice, sweeter than lemon but more sour than orange. All the way at the back, an earthy, dim but undeniable hop bitterish touch pops up too, perhaps disturbing this fruity-salty tartness a bit, but adding another layer of flavor to the whole; retronasally, these Citra hops also provide lovely citrus aromas blending in completely with the actual citrus. This is craft beer at its best: we are far removed from the historical Gose here, the salty accent is there but remains subtle enough so as to let the crisp, lively, extremely refreshing citrus acidity do its work, beautifully enhanced by the Citra and by the lactic tartness of the basic beer. I never suspected a Gose could be so... sunny, lets say. Mission accomplished and I will recommend this as a summery quencher: though only 3.8% ABV, this is packed with flavor, elegant and delicate. A fascinating little beer!

Taste of tart lemon, lime, grapefruit, tangerine, pineapple, peach, mango, orange peel, sea salt, wheat, cracker, light funk/pepper, and floral/grassy earthiness. Very nice complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, oranges, citrus/tropical hops, and light pale malt flavors; with a great malt/bitter/tart/spicy balance and zero astringent flavors after the finish. Good dryness from acidity and bitter/spiciness as well. Medium carbonation and light body; with a very smooth, crisp, moderately acidic/saline, and lightly sticky/grainy balanced mouthfeel that is nice. Alcohol is very well hidden with zero warming present after the finish as expected of 3.8%. Overall this great fruited gose. All around great complexity, robustness, and balance of fruity/acidic yeast, oranges, citrus/tropical hops, and light pale malt flavors; and very smooth, crisp, and refreshing to drink with the balanced acidity. A very unique and enjoyable offering for the style.

Bottle at 100 piv. Salty, bitter, intensely fruity, exotic, maracuja. Very refreshing, high carbonation, easy drinking. Very good.
Bottle from 100 pív. Yellow color with thick white head. Oranges, zest, bisciut malt in aroma. Taste, oranges, zest, salt, maracuja. Very good.

Refrigerated 11.2 oz. brown bottle poured into a glass. Hazy bright orange with small/medium white head. Aroma is orange/herbal hops, medium body, medium/low carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is rounded orange, herbal hops, and slightly tart. Surprising amount of herbal hops for the style.
Bottle from Kihoskh, Copenhagen - golden yellow pour. Aroma and taste is citrus fruity, citrus peel, light salty, wheaty, grassy hoppy, enjoyable brew.

Can, Brewdog Leicester. Hazy yellow orange with a thin head. Lemon and grapefruit with tart green apple. Yeasty with minerals and Alka-Seltzer. Hints of cheese funk with mellow oranges, apricot and pineapple. Good.

Bottle from Kihoskh. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, citrus and moderate hoppy - citrus and fruity. Flavor is medium sweet and moderate bitter. Dry and moderate bitter finish with a touch of salt. 301215

11.2 ounce bottle poured into a snifter. The beer is a clear yellow with a white head of foam. The aroma has piny, citrus rind, but the taste gives more of the sourness I am looking for. I get a nice, juicy orange with medium to high acidity. Nice sourness with a pleasant fruity character. Medium body and medium carbonation. Really a delicious beer. The aroma doesnt quite do the beer justice. Very tasty.

Bottle from Uba ja Humal. Pours hazy pale yellow with white head, the head stays. The aroma is super fresh, light and unripe, first thing that struck was yoghurt with green grapes, but that was only for a moment, later I do get the juicy oranges, as well as the wheat, and much more saltiness than in the last Gose by To Øl (and Buxton) I had, Coral Seas. Very well balanced, its just enough sweet, tart, salty, fresh and fruity. Close to watery light body, palate slightly sticky with a dry finish. Good, I liked it - went down with great ease.

Bottle, 3.8%. Hazy golden with medium off-white head. Aroma is malt, hops, citrus, peach, oranges and tropical fruit. Flavour is malt, fruit, hops, lemon, little slat, spices, oranges, peach, little tart, little sour, little dry, little sweet,

Bottle. Pours hazy golden, medium off-white head, great lacing. Aroma is a wonderful dirty sweaty mix of tropical fruit, armpits, sea air, passionfruit and guava. Flavor is light tart, citrus, dank sweat, light salt on the finish. Light body. Flavor not quite up to aroma, but nice nonetheless.

Bottle pours at Shelton Fest. Small snifter pour was hazy yellow with a modest head. Aroma is lemon, lime, funkiness, brine, and cereal. The taste is similar with a nice fruity start and a tart salty finish. So easy to drink. I sampled 3 of them. One of my favs of the weekend.

Yumm; what a pleasure. Cant hardly fault it. Great frothy head. Aroma is hops, tart, fruit, hint of salt. Flavors like nose with carbonation perfectly enhancing tart, lemon, bitter is just right. Clean and crisp. I think the best gose Ive had.
Bottle. Hazy golden color, white head. Aroma has nice berry notes and fruity hops. Sour berry taste, little malty, some hops.

Flaska @ Peas & Honey, Malmö. Dimmigt gul öl med ett medelstort lätt bubbligt vitt skum. Dofter av persika, citrus, passionsfrukt, salt och gräs. Detsamma återkommer i smaken. Krispig avslutning. Medelkropp.
33 cl bottle @ home. Pours cloudy golden with a white head that leaves quite a bit of lacing. Aroma and flavour are lemons, herbs, and spices - with a slightly tart finish.

Bottle:
Pours slightly hazy gold with a small white head.
Pineapple, wheat, lemon scent.
Taste is mildly salty....very citrusy...
Lemon, pineapple, grapefruit, wheat malt.
Increasing saltiness.
Really nice and sharp.

Bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Looks solid; a mostly transparent gold with white head and lively carbonation. Smells of Amarillo with some tartness and a bit of wheat. Tastes like it smells with a bit of salt as well. Mouthfeel is medium-bodied, semi-tart, and semi-dry. A good take on the style.

Botte. Pours a clear yellow with a small white head. Aroma has hops, pale ale malts, slight lactic tartness, dry yeasty notes, grape fruit juice, slight leather. Taste is more lactic sour, still very fruity and hoppy and, citric. Like lemonade. Nice high carbonation and a light body. Not catching a lot of salt though.

330 ml bottle. Pours a cloudy gold with light to moderate head. Aromas of fresh cut peaches and nectarines with a little wheat. Flavors of yellow stoned fruit, mangoes and salt. A great beer for quaffing at the pool. Fantastic for the ABV .

Draft at Ei8ht Ball, served in a flight. Pours a lightly cloudy yellow-gold with a small white head that settles into a ring and laces the glass. Notes of lemon, lime, light acidity, salt, and dishrag. Light-medium bodied, with a tart and dry mouthfeel and moderate carbonation. The weird dishrag note drags it down, and I dont think it was the glass, as the rest of the glasses were fine.

Oct 2015 - Bottle share at the top of 1 Canada Square, thanks to Foigus. Hazy pale orange, still, small foamy white head. Aroma is lime, spice, rubbery hops. Body is light, tingly carbonation, slightly foamy. Taste is lime, mint, smooth and rounded malt background, a touch sour. Really nicely fruity and balanced for the style. Very good.
Aroma is strong lime, spices and a hint of fruit. The flavor is fruit, salt/minerals, lime, malts and a tart/slightly sour finish.

8th October 201542nd Floor Tasting. Thanks to Fergus. Lightly hazy gold beer, small white head. Palate is light , semi dry and mildly crisp. Modest sourness, little lemon and a touch of pineapple. Light savoury character. Light finish. Decent.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2015 Pours a hazy golden yellow from the bottle with minimal head or carbonation really. Aroma of nice citrus, tropical pineapple and mango over orange and lemon, hint of earth. Taste follows, clean and easy, sour and salty are minimal but present. Wish there was some bubbles going on, otherwise a great beer.
Bottle. Pineapple/lemon, wheat malt, salt, and straw aroma. Golden yellow with small head. Salty-sweet pineapple/orange/lemon, wheat malt, and straw flavor. Good body. Very good.

Bottle 330ml. [ As To Øl Gose To Hollywood ].Light unclear medium yellow color with a average, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is light to moderate malty, pale malt, moderate yeasty, passion fruit, pineapple, soured milk. Flavor is moderate sweet and light acidic with a long duration, salty, passion fruit, tropical fruit, dry, tart. Body is medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20150911]

Bottle (tallinn). Pale yellow fizzy. Nice clean citrus, lemony, weak (wheat) malty ose. Feels refreshing, fresh. Light bodied, fizzy, slight tart dry finish. Pretty well flavoured though, citrussy, refreshing.-- bb
Pours a light cloudy yellow with fizzy head. Aromas of lemony and fruity tartness. Light tartness followed by some salty notes and a lemony zest finish.
Bottle @ Christian Firtal, Odense. Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, herbs, spices and malt.

Bottle at the sky high Canary wharf tasting. Translucent yellow/ straw coloured pour with a halo of thin white head. Aroma is pithy lemon, mango, salty, pithy lemon, Flavour is crisp is salty, pithy, lemon, pez sweets and pollen, floral. Lovely. Palate is crisp, slightly salty, lemon, citric acid. Tangy. Solid. Love it.
Aroma: grapefruit, vinegar. Appearance: rocky head, white lasting foam, cloudy liquid, pale. Taste: heavily sour, salty. Not my kind of taste. Palate: light body, thin feel, average carbonation.
Bottle at home... Light golden.. Thin white lacing... Soft floral lemon fruits nose.. Zezty sherbert lemon.. Juicy tart lemon fruits.. Zezty lemon
Lime sherbutty with a very light acidity. Pale yelliw with some gaze. Good nose. Sweet end. Nice.
Bottle at craigs. Pours hazy yellow, nose is grapefruit, yeasty, taste is salty, fruity citrus.
Hazy golden liquid with frothy white head. Aroma of spruce, rubber. Salty sour grapefruit, medium bitter, medium sour. Palate: light body, thin feel, average carbonisation, long finish.
From bottle. Pours light hazed, with a white head. Aroma of citrus, tangerine, taste is tart and acidic, lots og tangerine, fresh, very light grain in the back. I could drink this all night!
Hazy golden with a small white head. Fruity aroma with a touch of grapes. Dry and tart flavour with lots of fruit.

330ml bottle (Gambrinus, Tartu)
Pleasant citrussy aroma, mandarin, a bit of lemon. Light wheatiness. Watery palate, just gently sharp and a little salty. Some wheatiness in the taste, bit of lemony citrus again. Bland and unsatisfying, but not actually bad.
The Sampler, Brooklyn tap: pours light gold with white head. Aroma is orange, yeast, and mineral. Taste is orange fruitiness. Light saltimess. Light sweetness. Kind of simple but pretty dank.

33cl bottle at the 42nd level tasting, London. It pours a light golden color with medium white head. Aroma is grain, starch and salt. Taste is much nicer with sour fruits, apricots. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, good

Bottle split at the 42nd floor Tasting, thanks to Fergoose, 08/10/15. 
Clear golden with a moderate off white covering.
Nose is punchy citrics, tropical piss, damp hay, funk, lemon rind.
Taste comprises tangy tropicana, hay bale, light acidic zip, trace of salt, lemon zing, straw.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with the gentlest of puckerings.
Solid #
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London - thanks to Fergus. Pours yellow-gold, clear, with a white foam head. Salty lemon aroma, pithy citrus, wheat, rind. Light sweet flavor, nice lemony tartness, crispy grain, hay. Light bodied with fine, spritzy carbonation. Pleasantly tart lemony finish, cleansing, some salt, sweat. Very nice.

Bottle at Dansken, Göteborg. Clear pale golden beer with a rich and lasting offwhite head. Sourish fruity aroma, grass notes, grapefruit, hay, some lemon zest. Lemon zest flavor, salty, grapes, pine, some lime, earthy, peach notes. Refreshing beer.
vague earthy citrus aroma, pale gold with a thin frothy head, oh my its sour, sour lemon flavour, superb a bit thin but doesnt detract

Bottle. Pours a clear light gold with a white head that dissipates slowly to the edges. Aroma has a decent amount of sweet tropical fruits with a light tartness and some sweet wheat. Flavor combines earthy tropical fruits with a decent amount of tartness nod a sweet wheat backbone.
Light straw pour capped by w white head. Solid corriander presense with mild tartness. Light body, very drinkable.

Honningfarvet og ufiltreret Gose med 1 cm hvid skumtop. Dansk opskrift og produceret på De Proef i Lochristi i Belgien. 
Fersken, mango, noter af hav, æble fylder næsen. 
Smagsindtrykket er syrligt og salt. Samt en smule sødme. Indtryk af grapefrugt. Middel syrlig, let saltet og let sødme. Øllets krop er middel fyldig og karboneringen er ligeledes på et middel niveau. Afslutningen er tør og syrlig. 
En frisk og middel syrlig Gose, som er en helt ny øltype for min smag. En øl velegnet til varme sommerdage /-egne.
33 cl, flaske, 3,8 % ABV, BB: 01/06/17.

Bottle. Pours light hazy yellow with a medium white head. Aromas of citrus, hops, light lactic, tropical. Taste is citrussy, subtle saltiness, hoppy, lactic, pineapple.

330ml bottle from Brewdog.com. Pours hazy orange with thin foamy white head. Aroma of freshly squeezed lemon and lime. Taste bears wonderful clarity with crisp, tart citrus and a lovely salty sour finish. Hugely refreshing sour.
Bottle. Pours a hazy yellow color with a small white head. Has a fruity weak sour spicy peachy aroma. Fruity sour tart peachy flavor. Has a fruity sour tart peachy finish.

Bottle. Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma of hops, lactic tartness, orange, lime and some weak tropical notes. The taste is tropical, salty and citrusy with a nice lactic tartness as well. Simple and gentle but indeed good!

bottle at home from brewdog onlineonly lightly tart, fruity apricot on nose. refreshing tartness, moderate bodied, citrus and tropical fruit, salt in finish. Corriander must be low in mix as not really discernible. A decent easy drinking gose.

Bottle thanks to allmyvinyl. 
Appearance - golden orange with a nice lacy head. 
Nose - salt and herbs. Very floral. Plant stalks. 
Taste - salt and citrus. Preserved lemons. 
Palate - light to medium bodied with a creamy texture and a long dry tangy finish. 
Overall - really well made.

500ml bottle shared with Ashton McCobb. Pours hazy pale yellow gold with a thin white head. Aromas of dried herbs, sour lactic thing going on, salt. Taste is citrus, lemon, light salt, light sour. Sour finish.

330ml bottle. Clear deep golden color. Small size, white head, stays. Fruity, sweetish, thistle, herbal in aroma. Sour, grainy, lemon juice, mango, passionfruit and slightly salty taste. Intensive and sharp acidic lemon juice in aftertaste. Did you just mixed pale ale and lemon juice together and then added bit of salt? Because it feels like you did just that. Questionable brew.
Bottle @ home. Milky light golden pour with a frothy head. Notes of lime, orange juice, light salt, grains and some light acidity. Good stuff!

(330ml bottle @ VilleValla Pub, Linköping, Sept 4 2015) Pours lightly hazy gold with a small head of big bubbles. Nose of orange rind, coriander, fresh grass, wheat malt, a bit pungent and bitter but with salt hints. Palate is lactic and citric sour, lemon and orange, grass, leaves, light coriander. Salt hints from middle on, not super strong. A touch bitter on the finish with citrus pith and herbs. Light bodied with light big bubbled carb. Fresh and fruity for a gose but thats no bad thing, still has the touchstones of the style as well. Refreshing.

33cl bottle @ home. Pours amber color with a thin, but lasting white head. Aroma has dried apricots, tangerine and tartness. Taste is acidic, has dried apricots, sour berries and some slight saltyness in the tart finish. Really refreshing.

Hazy yellow color with a nice head for a gose. Aroma is really fruity, with lemon, lime and also some funky notes and a bit of salty minerality. Taste is tart, lemony and refreshing. Not really salty in the taste but you definitely get some mineral notes. Very nice, easy drinking and refreshing gose.

Review based on the BJCP2015 guidelines (style 27: Gose). Bottle 33 cl - Batch unknown. AROMA: distinctive orange/tangerine aroma with a slight fresh note. APPEARANCE: yellow to light ambar color and hazy. average creamy white head with good retention. TASTE: mild salty flavour with prominent orange notes. low bitterness with a semi-dry, doughy and somewaht salty finish. PALATE: medium-low body with medium carbonation. slight salty sensation. OVERALL: a good Göse interpretation with an orange twist.
Bottle. Pours yellow gold white head. Nose/taste of lemon, sea salt, coriander, sour wheat and light funk - Lighter bodied.
Really nice light gose beer, almost like a light sour . Yeasty aroma, with a clean sour finish

Pours hazy light orange with a low white head. Aromas of citrus, funk, coriander, green apple, gooseberry. Taste is citrus, funk, green apple, coriander and gooseberry. Mouthfeel is tart and dry with medium carbonation.

Hazy yellow beer, medium white head. Nose is citrus, hops, sour notes, slight funk. Flavor is sour, grainy notes, hops and fruity notes, finishes with more sourness, lactic notes, citrus. Pretty refreshing.
Bottle from Kihoskh in Copenhagen. Fruity smell with citrus and lime. Similar taste with lots of citrus fruits. Very refreshing. Summer beer!
0,33L bottle (from UJH, Tallinn). Pours golden with off-white head. The head stays. Aroma is sour, citrus, popcorn, diesel. Flavor is sour, citrus, lemon, diesel. Overall: good.

Bottle from BottleDog. It pours hazy golden orange with a small white head. The nose is fresh, juicy orange, peach, apricot, lactic notes and some herbal action. The taste is crisp, lightly tart, lactic, mild acidity, juicy orange, mandarin, apricot, minerals, herbal notes, light saltiness and sherbet with a dry finish. Light - medium body and moderate carbonation. Great balance, refreshing and just so very drinkable. Great stuff.
Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Cloudy yellow - white head. Flowery. Elderflower. Light bitterness. Sour. Lacto notes. Light salty. Light malty. Lots of citrus. Nice.
330 ml bottle at Brewdog gbg. Hazy golden with white head. Aroma malty and tart, lactic and salty. Taste is clean, tart, lactic, lemon, grapefruit peel, with a slight salty finish
Golden colour with a medium steady head. Lemon, citrus taste; lemony sourish. Great taste form the low abv. Gose touch, what is not my fabourite style but this one is Verry drinkable.
Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has lemons, straw, salt. The flavor is sweet with notes of lemons, wheat, and straw, leading.

Bottle at Mikkeller & Friends.
Hazy amber colored with a medium sized white head.
Fruity aroma of peaches, hops and citrus.
Fruity flavor of citrus and peaches with notes of hops.
Citric finish.
33 cl bottle. Pours hazy yellow with a small white head. Grapefruity and peachy hoppy. Mild milky. Light citric and smooth fruity. Crisp fruity finish.

Bottle. Light hazy light orange liquid with medium white head. Aroma of lemon, orange, light coriander, light grain and light apple. Taste is dry and medium sour with notes of orange, lemon, light salt, light coriander and grain. Light to medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really drinkable and citrusy. Great.
